result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy A Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 8/01/22 and pay the surcharge by 5/31/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 5/31/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
With credit of 5 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy A Jenkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leroy A Jenkins in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 5 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by 8/01/22 and pay the surcharge by 5/31/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 5/31/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Leroy A Jenkins in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Rebholz requests a short adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm

Defendant Leroy A Jenkins in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rebholz has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. *.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

11:25 AM Defendant Leroy A Jenkins in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Leroy A Jenkins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leroy A Jenkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
